We Made a Shirt to Thank All the Beans—And to Raise Money for World Central Kitchen | Bon Appétit

We’re honoring the pintos, mayocobas, limas, and garbanzos of the world with a tribute T-shirt, one of several new items we just added to our little merch shop. 100 percent of the net proceeds from the sale of these Beans tees will go to support the inspiring, critical work happening over at World Central Kitchen in the face of COVID-19: providing fresh meals to those in need, putting restaurants back to work, and feeding frontline healthcare workers.Looks good, right?
What else is new in the shop? Well, we’ve re-stocked some old favorites in fresh, spring-y colorways, and we’ve added a GIANT new tote for your next contactless grocery (or wine) run. Our amazing staff photographer Laura Murray took pictures, from a safe, six-foot distance, of the BA staff sporting the latest gear. Head over to our shop to get your merch!New items besides the Beans tee!Photo by Laura MurrayDo You Have Any Natural Wine (Totes)?We designed our dream bag, made in Los Angeles by the folks at Everybody.World: sturdy-but-soft cotton, two built-in interior wine sleeves, and a big, comfy strap. This guy is roomy enough to carry a haul of groceries, a couple bottles of wild-fermented who-knows-what, and a small animal.Looks good, right?
The Iconic Claire Shirt—Now in Pink and PurpleOur homage to the queen, Claire Saffitz, and her stunning streak of silver hair. Now available in two new colors we’ve named Pink Radicchio and Ube, because clearly we have too much time to think about these things.Fresh Shades of The Test Kitchen ShirtOur best-selling shirt showing the layout of the BA Test Kitchen, now in colors we call Chimichurri (green) and Soft Scramble (yellow).And LOTS of New Colors of Our Classic BA ShirtDoes our logo in spring colors look more sweet?Explore Bon AppétitCoronavirusShoppingRecipes you want to make.
